Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Even includes breakfast and dinner”
Reviews.Author: vikkij1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while attending a conference at The Bell Conference Center. There are closer hotels to the conference center but I am a hilton honors member and I like to get the points. This hotel is a half mile from the center. It is within walking distance (a couple of blocks) from The Space Needle and the monorail, which takes you right to Westlake Center. From Westlake Center you can walk to Pike Market, The Hardrock Cafe and The Original Starbucks. From the airport I took the light rail to Westlake and then took a cab, which was 1 1/2 miles and cost me $7. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. Staff were very nice and helpful. Dinner and Breakfast is included in your rate. It was good food too. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: mckennly
Reviews.Content: After flying in early from NJ to attend a 3 day conference in the Conv Ctr, I was happy that my early check-in request was honored & my room was ready. The front desk staff was very nice/ friendly & helpful with directions/suggestions. The Hilton hotel chain hasn't disappointed me yet. The comp breakfast & light dinners were more than ample. The room/rooms were bigger than my apt at home. It was so convenient to have a refrigerator already in the room, instead of having to order one upon arrival & pay extra daily for it. The 3rd floor corner room (Western & Boren) was a little noisy with traffic at times, but like the other reviewer, I kept the fan on a lot to block it out. The other downside was that Housekeeping was not up to the usual Hilton standard. Once I needed to ask for face cloths & hand towels. Another time the garbage wasn't dumped. Also since the Hotel is located above the downtown area, each walk around was always a hike back uphill. In all, I would recommend this Hotel & stay there again as it is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AS-Bham
Reviews.Content: Customer service was great once we arrived. Had I only had the experience over the phone I would have said otherwise since I had the joy of speaking to a somewhat rude person when I called to confirm our stay. Our room was clean and spacious and worked very well having two children with me. The linens were very nice however the beds were hard so I didn't sleep very well. The second night we were there I pulled out the sleeper sofa in hopes that that mattress was softer but it wasn't at all. Matter of fact, there was a bar poking up in the middle.The breakfast buffet was wonderful though. The food was good and the dining area was nicely laid out. When we first got there the tv in the bedroom wasn't working but with a simple call to the front desk it was taken care of. Within 5 minutes a maintenance man came up and fixed it. Overall our stay was very nice. I rated this hotel as average mostly because of the beds and the poor customer service I received by one of the agents there. A good night sleep is very important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel that throws in extras”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1979154935
Reviews.Content: THis hotel is located in a quieter part of the Seattle waterfront. It is a low rise and has some nice views facing the waterfront. The rooms are a good size and the beds are comfortable. The Monday to Thursday light dinners are very good and a great deal and they throw in a wine and beer! The breakfasts are also an added plus but are quite average. The hotel staff is helpful and friendly and they have rooms for pets. The parking is extra which I always find annoying. The walk to Pike Street is about 10 minutes which might be a bit much for some people. We would definetly come back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Floridatraveller75
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff greet you by your name. Larger than average comp. breakfast buffet. Comp. buffet style dinners during the week with rotating menu. One bedroom suite was nice, appeared clean. Beds were shot though...boxsprings looked old and mattress was worn and uncomfortable. Would have liked the paper coffee cups replenished daily as I don't like using hotel glassware in the rooms. Quiet. Good amount of cable channels on the tv. Would go back for business stay- this was much better than other local hotel on Queen Anne.

Reviews.Title: “a must for families”
Reviews.Author: MarcotheRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I needed the extra space and full kitchen for my toddlers. The beds were comfortable, and they had a handful of HD channels which some hotels are not offering. The breakfast was more than I expected with hot items eggs and breakfast sausages. The front desk has take out menus.

Reviews.Title: “Convient location to Seattle Center”
Reviews.Author: Alaskan99
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was really nice. The first day I was there 3/4 towels had women's head hair in them. Fortunately, the towels for the remainder of the week were completely clean. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and wake-up calls. Despite being on the top floor, the adjacent road is very noise during commute hours, so if you are a light sleeper, may want to request a room away from the Western Avenue. The breakfast in the morning was very generous and a good time and money saver. The internet access was responsive and well connected throughout the whole suite.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Suites”
Reviews.Author: FleischmanX4
Reviews.Content: While the suites are quite roomy, we got the two bedroom suite, the amenities are average at best. The location is a bit awkward to get to anything. We did a stay-cation and I brought four girls for a sleepover and they loved it, the master bedroom had a partial view of the Space Needle. Having a refrigerator and full kitchen was quite convenient, however the fridge was not in the best shape (things were broken on the inside) and there wasn't any dish soap with which to wash the dishes. The bathroom was below average, the tub was cracked and old and there was no way to turn off the noisy fan. As for the Continental Breakfast, their spread was less than I expected. The omelets were microwaved and rubbery, the hashbrowns were dry and microwaved. Pretty much everything that was heated up was a microwaved meal, it tasted awful. They did have two different cereals to offer and some yogurts, however there were no waffles nor bagels to be found anywhere. The service there was great, we were quite pleased with that aspect. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend this place to friends or family and won't be staying there again considering their price per night. Especially considering there was no swimming pool, in fact the only thing they had for kids to do was ping pong.

Reviews.Title: “Great family property”
Reviews.Author: FerryCaptain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 15 month old daughter. The rate was great for downtown, parking was only $15/day (self park in the same building). Hot breakfast every day and Welcome Home reception in the evening. Clean and relatively central location. All the rooms are suites, Studio, one or two bedroom. Good sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, big room, great bed!”
Reviews.Author: mary h
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks on a business trip. There is no airport shuttle which stinks, but then they charge $5 a day to park your rented car! Hotel is in a nice safe area. Can see the water from upper floors. I had a corner suite on second floor and the noise from traffic was pretty loud, but I learned to ttune it out. The daily breakfast was great. Dinners on Mon-Thur were mediocre. Lots of good restaurants in walking distance. Staff were friendly and helpful. Really loved the little kitchen area because there is a great local grocery store just up the street where I could buy staples and fresh fruit which was nice. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Will definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: scochelle
Reviews.Content: Was extremely surprised by how awesome this hotel was!! OK fine so it is not right downtown, but it is merely 2-3 blocks from a whole bunch of restaurants, starbucks, etc.. so people who i have noticed that are complaining that it is so far from everything - try going outside and walking - there are lots of options around! INCLUDING a safeway right down the street so for people who want to bring back food to cook! Firstly check in was quick, parking was easy (although for future, i would recommend just parking on the street, i think it is cheaper than the $15/nt the hotel charges) - we parked in the parkade because it was rainy outside, and didnt know how safe the area was.. but now we know, likelynext time we will do the street. Once we got to the room - we thought we were at home! OK we are used to metropolitan Vancouver urban lifestyle with 700-900sq. ft. living being the norm.. and this room must have been 600-700 sq. ft.! TV room, kitchen, bathroom, and bedroom - what else do you need! Plus with free wifi, and an AMAZING breakfast (different each morning!) - next time i am back in town i will for sure stay here. We booked from Hotwire, $85ish/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay just outside of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: KUKatie
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel and was our homebase on our trip to Seattle and the surrounding area. As is customary with Hiltons and Homewood Suites the staff was wonderful and very helpful by recommending great local resturants and other attractions to see and do. The room was large and comfortable but we didn't really have a view so I would recommend getting a harbor view and asking to be on the top floor. The location is a few blocks from the Seattle Center and is in a really cool little neighborhood which is worth walking around. If you want to be close to Pike's Market and the waterfront however there were other properties that were closer than where we were. That being said the hotel was at the lower end of other hotels in the area and it did include breakfast so that was what helped us make our decision to stay here. This hotel is also where a lot of Alaska Cruise guests stay so if you are looking for a pre or post night this seemed to be a popular choice. We enjoyed our stay but honestly were not in the room that much because we were out exploring the city. However I have recommended this hotel to others and I would stay here again. The staff and the feel of the hotel really make it stand out and again the area of town is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: MaraInTO
Reviews.Content: We - family of 3- stayed here a week and were very impressed. Complimentary breakfast and dinner. Free WIFI. Very close to Seattle Centre- no more than a 10mins walk; and, a 20mins walk to Pier 66 & 70. This is not a downtown hotel but makes up for far away location with great services. Staff is courteous and helpful and will book packages for you at hotel discount. The suites are incredibly spacious and very clean. Our room was quiet but faced 2nd Ave. and not Western Ave. which is a major road. We booked online and got a very good rate. Zipcars are just around the corner also. Parking is availabe if you drive. Grocery store is a 5mins walk away. Laundry room onsite.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellent base for Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneWriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around the same time last year and werenâ€™t disappointed on returning. Our one bedroom King suite was spacious, with everything clean and well maintained. There was no window in the living area but this didnâ€™t bother us because the lighting is good and the bedroom had a big window. The floor plan on the web site shows other layouts so look for one of these suites if youâ€™d prefer windows in both rooms. We found the guest laundry, business and fitness centers to be well maintained and staff were all friendly and helpful. The Monday to Thursday Welcome Home evening drinks and snacks were good and very popular with guests. We didnâ€™t have a car here and walked to Seattleâ€™s main business center a couple of times and down along the harbour area. The hotel is not in the main shopping area, but itâ€™s easy to get there by walking or taking the monorail from the Seattle Center about four blocks away. We found several places to get food for dinner. We recommend the small but excellent Samâ€™s Sushi and the Safeway and larger market which has a great range of take-out things. There is a pub just up the road where (sadly) a lovely Italian restaurant used to be, if you want pub food. If you have time, take the Seattle Underground Tour â€“ itâ€™s a great couple of hoursâ€™ experience. The guides are entertaining and the underground walking and access is easy. Thereâ€™s also plenty of light and air, and the whole thing is fascinating and brings the city of Seattle and its history to life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain65
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near Seattle center. We had a 1 bedroom King room. Lots of space. Nice little kitchen area for those staying longer than 1 night. Very comfy bed. Very clean. You can walk to many places from this hotel. I thought it was reasonably priced considering it's location. We had looked at several others on the water and the rooms were more per night and the reviews weren't as good. The breakfast was very good. They actually had real scrambled eggs that weren't runny. Mon-Thurs they also offered free dinner. We did not know that and ate elsewhere. Next time. We only stayed one night. Spent our other 3 nights near the airport because we were visiting a friend in Covington. Wish we had stay all 4 nights here. The bed was much more comfortable than the other place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Pier 91 Cruises”
Reviews.Author: Coloradodreamin8450
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel before embarking on an Alaskan Cruise. I am a frequent traveler and always try to book a Homewood Suites wherever I go. This hotel did not disappoint. The suites were clean and spacious and we had a nice view of the water from the 5th floor. There is a really nice waterfront park nearby where you can walk or jog. There is a free breakfast buffet that is excellent and it also has a decent gym. Its not right downtown but you can walk to the Space Needle and take the Monorail. My only complaint is that they offer a "free" shuttle service to Pier 91. When we got to the pier the driver demanded $5 per bag from everyone on the shuttle. The hotel should inform guests of this charge (assuming this was not a tourist shakedown by the driver).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Space to Move”
Reviews.Author: steel5rings
Reviews.Content: Our family of our stayed at the Homewood Suites in Seattle during the last week of August as part of a 10 day to Washington State. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with king bed and a sofa bed, with a partial bay view...room was very clean and comfortable with room to spread out. Location was great, near all the attractions, mins to the State Ferries and SAFECO Field. Parking was secure under the hotel for $15 a day. Hot breakfast saved us a good deal of money and it was good quality. Fridge in the room was also a money saver for Cokes and snacks. Rate was reasonable...we would come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: destination_sun
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 that stayed over the Labour Day long weekend. The price was right & we found the room to be above our expectations. We were in a 1 bedroom "bayview suite". It gave us a slight view of the water. The hotel is central to many sights which was great because we went to Seattle to experience all the touristy things the city has to offer. The free breakfast was great. Lots of options including sausages, bacon, eggs & fresh pastry. The breakfast staff were extremely polite & helpful. A special thanks to Rosibel for helping to make our stay great. Parking is provided in the secure underground lot & costs $15 a day (with in & out privs).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: BC-Jack63
Reviews.Content: We had four adults in a two bedroom suite and it worked out pretty well for us. In part due to my brother being willing to tough it out on a not some comfortable hide-a-bed sofa. The suite was spacious with two big bedrooms and a large living area with kitchen. All three sleeping spaces had their own T.V. The rooms were all very dark at night, which is good. Nothing to look at during the day which wasn't really an issue for us. Probably not for you either as there is plenty do to within walking distance of the hotel (and it is only about a ten minute walk to the free bus zone). The free breakfast was typical in terms of food, but they did a good job of keeping the supplies up and there was way more seating than most places I've been. Nobody was forced to eat off a coffee table in the lobby or anything. The also had a free evening meal on weekdays that was a surprise. The food wasn't anything to get excited about, but it was free and so was the beer and wine. Great for a pre-game meal before heading to the ballpark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.... but NO hot water in the Morning!”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot31310
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Homewood Suites since it was close to where I had a business meeting. Lots of street construction around didn't make it easy to get to. Parking cost an extra $15.00 but was in a secure garage. Got to my room, seemed nice enough. The AC unit was loud and there was a vent that couldnâ€™t be shut off in the bathroom that was so loud I had to close the door not to hear it. There was a good amount of street noise as it is a downtown location. TV selection was OK, but no menu card so I had to flip through to find the stations. I didnâ€™t find the bed too comfortable and the pillows were thin, one wasnâ€™t enough but two was too much for a good sleep. Woke up at 6AM to find no hot water! A pipe had broken and was being fixed.....the front desk really didnâ€™t seem to care, I only got a "sorry". Sorry doesnâ€™t work when you have a business meeting and you canâ€™t shower! Since it was a kitchenette room I was able to boil water on the stove to be able to clean up as much as possible. Interestingly I found a 1/4 bottle of wine in the cupboard when looking for a pot to boil water. This leads me to believe that housekeeping isnâ€™t that thorough? Breakfast was typical, not special. When I did check out the manager did not charge me for the room, since they have a 100% satisfaction program. I told the manager he should have had a back up plan, maybe some baby wipes or similar for guests to use since there was no hot water. He said "Gee, we didn't think about that"! If they had and showed a bit of sympathy for the guests, it would have went a long way! This isn't a horrible hotel, it just a very bad experience so I would probably give them a second chance but they need better beds and pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Homewood Suites Quality, Nice Hotel but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MSUEngineer
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel nice and quiet. Staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The rooms are large with the typical suite-style separate rooms for the living room and bedroom, with kitchenette and bathroom inbetween. Location is safe and convenient to the Space Needle, but not the most conveniently located hotel. You will have a walk several blocks to find a restaurant. We were pleased with the hotel, but I will give housekeeping demerits for leaving someone else's hair in the bathtub and in the kitchen sink. Parking is limited and costs $15/night. Free parking is available on the street if you prefer.

Reviews.Title: “We like the suites, dislike the staff - terribly overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: pixielegfiend
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and we have stayed here prior - but usually only because the Hotel Monaco is booked and this is one of the few Seattle properties tha accept pets. However, the hotel was terribly overpriced this time, and was over $200 for one night. sorry Hilton specialty hotels, this class of hotel definitely does NOT warrant that price - or league!! Sorry!! It would also be nice if you offered your driving/ commuting guests a break on parking or free parking for one night, or something, considering you are in an area where there is literally room for about 10 or 12 guests on the street outside. It's also not the best area (between city and industrial) and it feels a bit scary to leave a $40K car outside. The place has always had chilly employees - none that I can ever remember being super friendly, but this time, two staff members on the night shift were DAMNED unfriendly, and one in the morning acted so put out, I wanted to strangle her! When asked to honor a $5 or $10 difference in rate between a smoking and non-smoking room (we don't smoke) guy at booking acted like he was doing me the hugest favor in the world putting me "making that exception." He called the smoking room "gross" in his opinion. I thought, "So why don't you clean it or overhaul it??" My honest opinion? Though I think the location is good for being outside the downtown walking range (takes literally 2 minutes to get to the center of action on 1st Avenue near Pike Place, and 2 minutes to get up to Queen Anne) I would almost - truly - rather stay in Bellvue or Kirkland and drive back and forth, than to stay here.... Don't get me started on the vomit left on the sidewalk just outside the hotel for ... ohh... I'm guessing about 20 minutes before someone cleaned it up. Meanwhile, we were checking in over the top of it. YUK! The best part about this hotel is, they do have one of the best breakfasts of a hotel of this type. Oh, and the lobby is quite beautiful. However, considering that it is on par with a $110 to $120 per night hotel, we overpaid for breakfast by about $90!!! My only other observation, which is important and I think should be addressed is: I asked for a razor in the morning, because we had left it at another hotel. They were accommodating and that was great, but when I asked if they had a complimentary disposable, she just said, "Yes." Not, "Yes, we do, would you like someone to run that up for you?" I asked and she hesitated, then sent someone up. But that is NOT hospitality. Take a lesson from Kimpton's book, Hilton - you would be a LOT more competitive in these lean times!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, close to attractions, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Doninchicago
Reviews.Content: close to free bus transportation, parking limited, helpful staff. rooms were large

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, consistent and worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonGunn
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel at the end of July for two nights before departing on a cruise to Alaska. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They are very knowledgable about the area and willing to offer any and all information for sight seeing, food etc. They are within walking distance of the Space Needle, Pacific Science Center, Pike Street Market, the aquarium and some other great sights. I also strongly recommend City Pass to plan your trip and see all the sights economically. The breakfast and dinner each evening are a great bonus - quality food and drinks go along with a very clean, spacious room. Definitely the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location not my favorite for Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hollykmarie
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Homewood, which I like for my sometimes extended business trips. For this July stay, it was filled with families on vacation, which made for a higher noise level than I'm used to on work travel, but I should have anticipated that. The hotel seemed a little overwhelmed at meal times by the volume, but the staff were very accommodating. I like locations where I can ditch the car, and this was just a little too far from most of downtown to do that every day - and the intersections a little less pedestrian-friendly here. For visiting Seattle Center it is ideal, and you can take the monorail to downtown. Bigger than average fitness center, no valet but parking a bit cheaper than it would be downtown, 2 blocks to a Safeway but not much else in the immediate area. Business center seemed not to have internet access or something, people were having trouble printing, but free internet in rooms is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect Set up for a Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaCappis
Reviews.Content: We liked many things about this hotel. The suites perfectly suited our group of 5 (2 rooms for us) which included everyone from a 10 year old to an 83 year old. The rooms were clean, spacious and well organized. The kitchen was extremely handy and the tuck shop downstairs sold all kinds of small grocery items incase you wanted to come home and heat up some soup or make mac 'n cheese in a pinch. The free breakfast was perfect for families with little kids. The hot food was not great (frozen/airplane quality) but the kids didn't mind. The grown-ups enjoyed the bagels and fruit. I would avoid Saturday and Sunday mornings though - it was a totel mosh pit. There wasn't enough staff to bus the tables so people were piling dirty plates etc. on empty tables, counters and even in the Lobby area. I had to knock on the kitchen door and track someone down when the milk pitchers were all empty and I saw an elderly lady slip on some spilled yoghurt on the floor. The other days of the week were fine, though. The location is perfect - just a 10 block walk to Pike's Market (for those who can do it - easy downhill on the way there but difficult and uphill on the way back) and the centre of it all. Our problem was that their website (as well as this one) touted a free all day shuttle to and from the Market area for hotel guests. This was the specific reason we booked at this hotel. With an 83 year old in our group the walk back to the Hotel was impossible. Luckily due to the proximity to the Market, the cab rides (2 cabs needed) was not too expensive - but the inconvenience of waiting for a cab at the waterfront for over an hour each time with a line-up of typically over 50 people was WAY too annoying. At least with a shuttle you could plan your day a bit. When we asked the staff about the shuttle, the staff apologized and said it had ended just the week before. When I told them it was the main reason we booked there they offered no alternate solution other than cabs at our own cost. The staff was friendly but seemed very overworked. One night we were trying to reach the front desk to ask a quick question (the only time in 5 days) and tried for over an hour, letting the phone ring sometimes 20 times. We eventually gave up. The decor is nice and modern, the place is clean and the rooms are a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location, esp for families”
Reviews.Author: commander36
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to downtown Seattle but at an affordable rate. This hotel is just north of the downtown boundary but certainly walkable. The free breakfast and manager's evening reception was also an incentive. These meals more than exceeded my expectations. The evening reception was more like a meal than a light snack. In addition, the staff were all very hospitable and helpful, from the front desk personnel to the dining room hosts and the managers who hosted the meal and drinks each night. All enquiries were met with a smile. We had a few housekeeping issues with our suite which we reported and these were pretty well attended to within 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we found this place”
Reviews.Author: CoachTrine
Reviews.Content: So, I used Trip Advisor to find this place and I am glad I did. I liked that it was off the beaten path a little bit but still considered "downtown" as we are not much for city noise. Our room was one of the two-bedroom king suites and I am glad we spent the short money to get the extra space. All of the two bedroom king suites are located on the back side of the building overlooking a quiet side street (and away from the trains - yea, or the views - rats). We had plenty of space for our two teenagers (opposite genders and needing their own beds!) - a king for us, a full or double bed for one kid and a pullout full or double couch for the other kid. The bathroom was very nice and large, the kitchenette was very small but adequate. One thing I was not prepared for in Seattle was the hills! It reminded me of San Francisco! So, even if you think it is a quick walk somewhere, it could be a half mile straight uphill. For that reason, we kept our car and parked it overnight in the locked parking garage for a mere $15 per night...cheap compared to most "downtown" places. Although I suppose you could walk to Pike's Place, it would be a REALLY long walk, so we ended up trying our hand at the bus that stops right out front of the hotel every half hour (during the middle of the day). The Space Needle was walkable, though...just uphill and a surprising challenge as a result. Thanks to Trip Advisor, I was prepared for the yummy full breakfasts and weekday dinners. The breakfasts were huge and hot and we were so glad they were included every morning. My husband and son ate a meatloaf dinner one night, and I think they enjoyed it. The staff was all very helpful and courteous. A couple of stray phone calls appeared on our bill as we were checking out that we did not make, but it was resolved (they were deleted) immediately. I would stay here again and have since recommended Homestead Suites to my brother and his family.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Zell
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Homewood Suites in many other locations around the country and this particular property is simply not up to Hilton standards. The furnishings and decor is in desperate need of upgrading. The wash cloths are thin and of very poor quality, the kind usually found in a much lower class hotel. The garage is very small and the key card entry is very awkward & inconvenient. Be very careful when exiting the lower level garage if your car is low to the ground or else the car will scrape and drag! The pillows are way too soft and the bed is very uncomfortable... too hard. Be aware that if you require a room with 2 beds, the 3rd floor is the highest floor with 2 beds. We were told eveyrthing about the 3rd left had only 1 bed. The best thing about this hotel are the very friendly staff who are exceedingly helpful. Nick at the front desk was very patient in trying to answer all of our questions. His recommendation of Buckley's Restaurant, which is in walking distance,was excellent. We walked several times to restaurants (despite the hilly streets nearby), simply because we were concerned that there wouldn't be sufficient parking space in the garage upon our return. Since we were paying for garage parking, we did not want to park our car on the street. There is a Safeway grocery store only a few blocks away if one is looking to purchase food items for use in the room. Incidentally, although most kitchen items were present, there were no paper towels in the room... which was a bit odd and unlike other Homewood Suites. Most Homewood Suites are much more spacious. This looks as if it may have been an older Homewood Suites or perhaps even another chain originally, that was converted. It's laid out very much like the old style Embassy Suites, but without an atrium. Although there was no charge for the Internet (we're Hilton Honors Gold members), I had continuing difficulty in accessing the internet. Basically each time I tried while in the room, my iphone would freeze up on the hotel website. I've never had this problem previously at other hotels. I'm not certain we would stay here again, although the convenience is a strong factor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good: a clean, big room with a kitchen”
Reviews.Author: RedSnapper25
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11pm. The receptionist, Lloyd, was very friendly and had calming presence. We really liked his professionalism and attitude that made us feel welcomed. Pros: We had a big room, two comfortable beds and a kitchen. They provided us with generous continental breakfasts. They also had a 24/7 snack stores just in case you craved for salty chips and sodas. Waking distance to and from Space Needle in a quiet neighborhood. Cons: A bit a way from Downtown Seattle. Taxi ride was about $8-$10. You can also get a bus $2.25 per person and need to have the exact change. There were a few couples with small children and the breakfast area could be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, soft bed!”
Reviews.Author: tampasteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night after a cruise. The hotel is convenient to the Space Needle, but a good walk from everything else, of course you could take a cab though. The rooms are modern and clean, with everything you would expect in a Homewood suites. There is a table with two chairs, couch, 2 flat screen TV's, bathroom with tub/shower, coffee machine, free WIFI, business center with 2 PC's and printers, etc. The beds were really soft and felt great! The neighborhood is residential and rather quiet for down town. The AC had trouble getting below 74, but that was not really a problem as it was cool outside (we did not complain to the staff either). The biggest problem with this hotel was the walk from it to any sights, it is about 1.5 miles to the Aquarium and 1 mile to Pikes Place and there is no viable transit (light rail, etc.) in this area of town yet, but if you have a car or do not mind walking then that is not a problem unless it is raining. But it is only .5 miles from the Space Needle and 1 mile from the cruise port (Norwegian cruises). There is a shuttle to all of the cruise ports, they charge $5 for the Norwegian port and $8 for the others (per person). Cudos to Ashleigh for her help with directions and stowing our bags before we could check in!

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: windycitytraveler51
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay while visiting our daughter. the comlimentary breakfast was great with a great view. the rooms were very comfy and temperature was easily regualated. a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to cruise ports”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeDaisy
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay of one night here prior to a cruise vacation. The staff are very helpful and the breakfast area was large with a great breakfast choices. Besides being close to the cruise ports, you can walk down to the waterfront and enjoy a scenic walking trail. There are also reasonable restaurants within walking distance and a grocery store nearby. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The room and location were surpringly fantastic for a family with toddler. Will definitely come again.”
Reviews.Author: lorien_i
Reviews.Content: We really liked the suite aspect of the room which worked incredibly well for us with a toddler. Having a little kitchen with a dishwasher and full-sized fridge was very convenient as was the separate bedroom/livingroom. Everything was comfy and clean and they obviously make an effort to anticipate every need. Even the plug-ins were plentiful :) The included breakfast was decent and had surprising variety. Even though the hotel is close to the freeway, everything was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: pflovett
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking to space needle and Pikes market but the are uphill. The hotel was comfortable and the have a nice evening snack and beverage hour for free. The bus downtown is free during the day which makes the city very easy to get around. We parked the car jat the hotel and did not use it until we went to the airport. We had the two bedroom suite and it was like a small apartment so we all had our own space and three televisions help the teens stay out of my hair. The night snack is really a full dinner with beverages included we had lasagne, salad, garlic bread and cake for dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised. Room description misleading.”
Reviews.Author: Mark77036
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were taking our first vacation in two years to celebrate our 19th wedding anniversary. We spent a few days in Vancouver then we took Amtrak to Seattle to spend a few days there. We booked a "King Bayview" suite at this Homewood Suites property (for which we paid more than a regular suite). We chose this property over another, less expensive, hotel near by because of the "bay view." We arrived at the hotel around 11:30AM and were told there was one room available. It was on the first floor. I asked if it had a bay view. The young lady told me it didn't. I told her that we had booked, and paid extra for, a suite with a bay view. She said none were "ready," but we could stow our luggage and one would be ready when we returned. Since check in time isn't until 3PM, this was understandable so my wife and I left our luggage and went to see Seattle. We returned later and were told we had a choice of 2 rooms. One was a large room on the first floor but had a lot of street noise. The other was on the second floor towards the back of the property and quieter. I asked if either had a bay view and was told no. I told the gentleman that I had reserved a "bayview" room and paid extra for it, and that's what I would like. He told me that there weren't any bay view rooms available but "that's ok because they cost the same as the regular room." (Not true according to the website I booked through.) After arguing with the gentelman for a while, we decided to take the quieter room and sort things out in the morning. When I opened the door to our "suite," it looked like 2 caves connected by a hallway. The rooms were cramped and dark. They looked nothing like the bright, spacious rooms on the website. As far as being quieter, well I guess that's relative. There's a train track about a hundred yards away. Yes, you can hear them when they go past along with the parking lot noise that's just outside the window. I called the front desk and told the young lady who answered that the room was unacceptable as it was not what we had booked. I asked to speak with the GM. Was told he was gone for the day. I asked to speak with a manager. I was told they were out. I asked if they didn't have a manager on duty. I was told that the gentleman who checked us in was the manager on duty. Didn't think speaking with him further would be helpful. My wife and I decided to end our vacation early and return home the next day. When I told the manager on duty of our decision his reply was, "ok." Seems like he didn't care that they had ruined the rest of our trip. I did email the GM of the property and the coporate customer care. Coporate customer care emailed back that they give the property management 3 days to reply. I did get a call from the GM who apologized for the trouble we encountered and said he would look into it. He also told me that the "bayview" rooms were not priced higher. He said originally there was nothing across the road from the hotel so all the rooms on the front of the hotel had a bay view. In the ensuing years, the other side of the road has been built up blocking the views from the lower floors. He said they still refer to them as "bayview" rooms because there "older clients" know that means the front of the hotel. I advised him that such advertising was misleading at best. I forwarded an email outlining this misleading advertising to corporate customer care. They haven't responded as of yet. They did refund the money for our one night stay per their corporate guidelines. It did not make up for a ruined vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Space Needle/Seattle Center/Pike Street”
Reviews.Author: crroal
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. A little nicer than the typical Homewood Suites I've stayed in. Stayed on the Weekend, so only saw the breakfast which was very good. No pool, but there is a Ping Pong table for the 'kids'. Parking is $15/night in underground parking and is fairly limited, esp for large vehicles. Had to park on the street half a block away after getting back at 11pm on a Saturday night and was full. Fairly easy walk to Space Needle, Science Center, etc. Can walk to/from Pike Street Market area, though it's a bit of a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mimi_bird
Reviews.Content: The location doesn't have a lot to recommend it but if you request an upper floor you will have a view of the lake beyond the corporate buildings and freight train tracks skirt the lakes edge. This is my second Homewood Suites stay and I am becoming a convert. You get so much more space than a hotel room for about the same price, plus the kitchen. This one had fewer pots and pans than some of the smaller chains but it had a dishwasher. I believe they also offer meals each night, included in your price but as a vegan who eats no wheat, I had little hope that there would be adequate sustenance for me there. I think the menus are more standard American meat and potatoes fare. They also offer a breakfast buffet, I believe but I did not sample it. The drawback to the room layout was there was only one window in the whole place - in the bedroom. The living room/kitchen area had none. Not a drawback if you are there for work and only in your room in the evenings but not as pleasant if you spend more time in your hotel room. Everything was tiptop shape, the staff took excellent care of me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: chef31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in Seattle visiting relatives. We originally selected this hotel simply because it was close to their apartment. As it turned out, it was close to everything. Within a few blocks, we were able to visit several unique restaurants and shops and the space needle. The KEY ARENA is nearby, too. The only problem was the uphill walk to all of them. At least it was downhill coming back. The room was excellent. We had a view of Pugent Sound. We were told to expect to hear some traffic on that side of the building, but did not notice it at all. The bathroom may be considered small to some, but it is adequate in size. The other rooms were very spacious and having two rooms with two TVs suited our travel style perfectly. The kitchenette appeared fully equipped, though we used it very little. We also enjoyed the in-house free hot breakfast. This feature goes a long way toward adding value to the price of the room. Every staff member we saw greeted us with a smile and were very accomodating and helpful. We really appreciated being informed by the desk clerk about the town car that we could schedule to take us to the airport for a flat fee of $40. We were concerned about using the mass-transit system without our guide/relative and this made the trip worry-free. We will definitely stay here when we visit Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “ok- not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lovethemouse-7
Reviews.Content: Rooms spacious. Location is not great for sightseeing. 15-20 minute walk (uphill) to space needle, and that's the closest "sight". Very disappointed in view from room. Called and e-mailed over a month in advance to make sure we had a water view for at least one of our rooms. One room looked on the street, and the one room that we were told had a water view was open to interpretation. Looking across a parking lot, 5 lanes of traffic, railroad tracks and between two buildings I guess a little water was visible. Perhaps if the room is on the top floor, there is a water view. The breakfast was a mess, although that could be due to guests filling several plates at once, all overflowing with food. The biggest issue is that our rooms were not cleaned the last 3 days of our stay. I asked the desk several times to have the rooms cleaned, and they never were cleaned. I finally tracked down a housekeeper the morning we left and got some clean towels to use. Ok if you get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood fan.”
Reviews.Author: KnowsHotels39
Reviews.Content: This Homewood Suites by Hilton is somewhat atypical of the brand. The location is superb -- exactly where you would want to be near the convention center and all of downtown Seattle. The common areas of the hotel do not resemble the typical Homewood Suites. The lobby and breakfast/dining lodge areas have clearly been updated and look quite sophisticated and inviting. The guest suites are oddly-shaped and designed for an ordinary Homewood. Obviously, this hotel must've been re-branded from something else. Nevertheless, it's still a comfortable room and the lay-out is probably the best the the re-designers could've achieved. If you request a high enough floor, you might even catch a glimpse of a skyline view, but I think most suites' views have been blocked out by competing high-rise buildings. The food and beverage offerings are typical of the average Homewood Suites fare -- complimentary and includes free beer and wine in the evenings. Meals are pre-prepared and re-heated, so these are not for the gourmet palate. In sum, the advantages outweigh the mediocrity so I would definitely recommend this hotel for any visitor to the Seattle downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s a â€œSweetâ€� Dealâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: PDX_Travel_Detective
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a â€œSweetâ€� deal for a large hotel room, small kitchen unit, complimentary continental breakfast, free internet, ideal location for Seattle Center and great walking opportunities along the piers. But, the housekeeping is slipping and the free continental breakfast is on sugar overload. Living Space: It is a huge room, which offers a sleeper sofa, coffee table, flat-screen TV, and a small table and chairs. The colors and dÃ©cor are simple and are of the typical hotel style. Upon first glance it looks clean but with a closer look at the TV and itâ€™s dresser/stand it all needed a good dusting. Bedroom: With the bedbug scare going around I didnâ€™t waste any time doing a search with the bed. We rolled back the comforter, looked at the linens and pillows, and examined everything for small black specs. We didnâ€™t see anything however maybe I just donâ€™t know what to look for yet. But in the meantime after examining the headboard and nightstands we found them covered in dust. And we all know dust contains dust mites and other human skin. Yuck! Housekeeping is doing a quick job and not being thorough. See pictures that document our observation. Bathroom: The bathroom seemed clean upon first glance, but it did not pass my washcloth test. I took a washcloth and soaked it with hot water and some soap. After wiping the floor in front of the toilet for just a little bit the washcloth turned black. *See photos. We initially thought the floor had been mopped because the tile grout was darker in the center of the floor and the cleaning service simply did not mop to the edges. Well, it never got lighter so that means it wasnâ€™t wet and it was simply very dirty. We noticed with the toilet that when you held the handle to flush you needed to hold the handle longer than usual and it needed to be flushed twice. The water pressure must be very low. An area of the bathroom that seems to be missed way too often and shouldnâ€™t be is the inside of the door. I saw filthy, smear marks left from someoneâ€™s hands and fingers. If someone is leaving a bathroom with unclean hands I donâ€™t want to even imagine why they are dirty. This is a sanitary issue that really needs to be addressed with the house cleaning service. Kitchen space: The small kitchen unit is a great bonus for any extended stay where you can fix some of your own snacks. There was a refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher and a few dishes and utensils. It seemed clean at that angle, however, the floor had that darkened grout in the more central section and then the grout was light and clean closer to the wall. Again, I did my washcloth test and found the floor to be filthy! *See photos. Continental Breakfast & Dining Room: â€œHomewood Sweetsâ€� has new meaning here. The Continental Breakfast is a deal if you are not picky and not concerned about having a sugar overload. We had breakfast there for a couple of different mornings. A few good choices included wheat bread, low-fat cream cheese, fresh fruit and water. I also tried the sausage patties, scrambled eggs and an omelet with cheddar cheese. The patty was cold, the eggs tasted fake and the cheddar cheese in the omelet was horrible. The food warmers were barely keeping the food luke-warm. It would be nice if the plates were warmed to keep the food warm just a little longer. For some healthy options it would be nice if the hotel offered low-fat cottage cheese for those of us that donâ€™t want to eat meat or fake eggs. Itâ€™s great mixed with the fresh fruit. The juice offered was orange and apple, which are heavy with sugar. Cranberry juice could be offered for those patrons that would like to cut sugar calories. There were assorted muffins but none were a dark healthy grain option. Cereals offered were also heavy with sugar. Coffee was offered around the clock and was fine for swigging down that high-sugar overload. But, for those Latte lovers it doesnâ€™t substitute and you will have to go on a hike to get your fix. We would highly recommend a bottle of hand sanitizer at the coffee bar and a sign to suggest using it. Some people do not wash their hands. Some people eat with their hands and then return for a coffee refill. Everyone is touching the coffee pumps, cups, straws and counter. The garbage can should have an open top that you donâ€™t have to touch. Hand sanitizer is good, please use it everywhere! The tables and chairs seemed clean and taken care of. The staff was on top of that and kept everything organized. It was a large dining room ready for a large crowd. The upholstered over-sized chairs around the tables at the windows are great for those over-sized sugar lovers. However if you are of a healthy, normal size you will sink in and feel like a toddler because your feet canâ€™t touch the floor. So theyâ€™re not that comfortable and hard to get out of. Some normal-sized upholstered chairs by the windows would be nice and be more practical. They would also fit around the tables better. View & Location: Location is great with its proximity fairly close to the water, park and the walking and biking trails. As well, the walking distance is convenient to the boardwalk, piers, great restaurants and the Seattle Center. Nice Bonus: Small store next to front desk is nice for small toiletries and goodies to eat. Guest Services Suggestion: Provide dial-up movies or rent DVD movies.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: xterrared
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights for business. The staff was wonderful from answering my questions as we walked to the hotel on the first night, getting mildly lost. They had our room picked out from the list I sent. Room 526 has a great view of the PI neon ball, that I liked. The staff were great with suggestions on transportation, local events and suggestions for the use of the hotel town car. The breakfast had a variety of food, hot and cold. Coffee was available all day. The room was quiet even with being on the busy street side with good views of the ships in the sound. I think the customer service was really outstanding. I got a kick out of how dog friendly the hotel was with meeting a nice black lab and a very happy beagle on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK Place to Stay; Spend the extra money and go to an Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: meskens
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late in the pm and was suppose to have a room reserved from a business block. They had no such block, but were very accomodating in getting me a room. I found out later that they had lost our block of rooms request plus I did not get the corporate rate agreed upon from the block. But, that shouldn't reflect on the hotel itself as that's probably all arranged through someone else. As I mentioned before, the staff was very helpful and a plus. I received a room on the 6th floor, which I guess was suppose to be something special. The furniture (especially the living room) was really old. The refrigerator looked ancient and was very loud. Although it was a larger fridge then you'd find in some other "suites" hotels. The bed and bedding, however, were very comfortable. The nightly "welcome home" reception was not that great. Keg beer and cheap wine plus the food didn't look very appetizing. Although I did have a salad. The morning breakfast was better (although I love breakfast food) with scrambled eggs, sausage links, oatmeal plus cold cereal, pastries and fruit. Parking is limited so I ended up paying $15 to park in the garage each night. The location, depending on what you want to do, can be a plus or minus. There is a little grocery store next door if you want to stock the fridge and Buckley's Pub is just up the hill. But for sightseeing or business, you will definately need a car. I spent $179/night (not including taxes or parking). I would probably recommend it at $129-$149, otherwise spend the extra $50 and go to an Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “could not be better”
Reviews.Author: GreyNomadMoruya
Reviews.Content: Arrived Seattle International at about 0600 local time (watches forward three hours) we collected our cases and looked for transport options to down-town Seattle.Â  We were advised to catch the train, great idea but none of those advising it knew precisely how to find the train.Â  It took a while because the facility was so new it hadn't yet been fully sign-posted.Â  We found the station and the automatic ticketing machine.Â  They are great, but totally useless when you don't know the local geography.Â  Which line, which station, what kind of ticket ??Â  Up to the platform and a very helpful security guard gave us all the information we needed.Â  $1.50 each compared with $35 for a taxi into down-town. We arrived at the central rail station and made it to the surface and being just 0730 there aren't many people about to ask for directions.Â  A man making deliveries to the corner drug-store pointed us in the direction of a taxi rank.Â  A quick ride had us at the hotel.Â  Welcome was fantastic, "Yes we have a room ready and breakfast is on for another half hour, do come down and join us - complementary".Â  The suite is enormous, two queen sized beds, full kitchen including domestic sized refrigerator and a dish-washer.Â  The lounge room has another flat panel TV, a couch and arm-chair and a desk with two chairs.Â  Yes there's a bathroom as well.Â  Lovely breakfast and crashed out for about 3 hours. Homewood Suites Seattle Downtown gets even better. As I said in my previous post, the suite was most impressive, but quite beyond expectation, the service continues to improve. One of my priorities was to get my Travel Insurance form printed off and returned to the insurer.Â  I took my PDF file on my thumb drive down to the front desk and asked if they could print it for me.Â  "No problem, but you are welcome to use our Business Center, it is complementary". Found a very smart Dell computer and a small laser printer, plug in the thumb drive and direct it to print the form, nothing happens, no paper in the printer, look around the room, no paper there either.Â  OK back to the front desk, explain my problem, profuse apologies and I'm handed half a ream of paper - no charge. Compare that to other hotels where they charge you by the page for printing. Having printed the form and filled it in, I need to fax it back.Â  Down to Lloyd at the front desk, some confusion on my part regarding the fax number.Â  He tries three or four combinations without success.Â  I asked him if he could scan it onto my thumb drive, sorry, the hotel doesn't have a scanner. Bugger!!Â  Lloyd is not beaten, "If you like, I could take this document home and scan it for you.Â  Can I have your email address ??"Â  He apologises that there may be a delay of some hours as he still has a few hours left on his shift. We retire to suite and flick though the numerous TV channels and generally sort out plans for the the next two days. There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel, plenty of those in the area. We were advised to head down to the dinning room where 'Management" provides a "Happy Hour" with complementary hot entree, beer and wine available for purchase.Â  The entree consists of a mini pizza, salad greens, dressings and fruit juices. This Happy Hour is provided Monday to Thursday !!!Â  How good is that ??Â  I forgot to mention, hot coffee and brew your own tea available all day as well.Â  Back at the suite there is an email from Lloyd with the scanned page attached I detach it and then forward it to the Insurer, within minutes there's a response from them thanking me for my prompt (?) action and hopes we continue to enjoy our holiday. A long day over and we head back to the suite. Next day a great way to start the day, a hearty breakfast in the dinning room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay to end our trip of the Pacific Northwest”
Reviews.Author: mcdana22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the tail end of our trip of the Pacific Northwest and loved it. We were lucky enough to get a parking spot out front and did not have to pay the $15 fee for parking. Upon check in we were greeted with very friendly staff and got a room on the 6th floor (top floor) with a great view of the Space Needle. (Do not waste your time or money on a Bay View, too many bldgs in the way). We became members of the Hilton rewards before we booked (free) and somehow got a great room out of it. We checked in at about 3pm, asked for an extra suitcase jack (1 for me and 1 for husband) and it was delivered immediately. The light dinner that was served every night we were there (Monday-Thurs) was perfect portions and decent variety everyday (note that only 1 entree is served with a salad, so you can't be pickey). Adult beverages are also included (beer/wine, lemonade, iced tea, water). The morning breakfast was also decent, but could be served a little later than 6-9am. There were always breads, bagels, juices, and hot food items like eggs, sausage, and oatmeal. My husband I spent everyday out and about the town after breakfast and were ready for a rest at dinner time. The two meals served by the hotel also kept our budget in check. We chose to splurge on food through out our city travels for lunch and snacks including eating our way through Pike's Market. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed our seperate living room area in case one of us wanted to stay up later to watch TV. The bathrooms were clean, but the water pressure could have been higher. We made use of the kitchenette to store leftovers for late night snacking and keep beverages and popcorn for late night movie watching. I borrowed a DVD player from the front desk (free) because I brought along some workout/yoga DVDs. The hotel is conveniently located to the Space Needle area, Duck tour, Science Center, Music and Sci-Fi museum. If you want to go to the waterfront (Aquarium, Pikes, Argosy Tours), walk 5 blocks to the first pier and catch the FREE BUS that travels the entire waterfront and all the way to Pioneer Square. If we return to the Seattle area, we wil definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price - but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Vauban
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, as part of a trip to the Pacific north-west. We were a family of five - with three kids in tow. On the plus side, the price was good, the rooms were spacious and well equipped, and they accommodated our family in one suite (few hotels seem to do so in Seattle). The beds were comfy too and service at the front desk was friendly. On the downside, the hotel is a bit far out from the centre of town. Close(ish) to the Space Needle, but much further to everything else (though there is a shuttle that runs along the front). Breakfast was completely chaotic - completely understaffed, no organisation, and running out of food items well before the end of the meal. And breakfast finished, in my view, way too early - 9am in fact. Our bathroom smelled mouldy - a very unpleasant smell that remained throughout our stay. And housekeeping missed a day - so we needed to call them in the evening for fresh towels, toiletries, etc. To be fair, they responded promptly, but it felt that the organisation of the hotel was a bit haphazard. All in all not a bad stay - and great for the price, particularly for a larger family. But unless you are a party of five, I think you could probably do better with somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneWriter
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of Homewood Suites and our first trip to Seattle. We often stay in other Hilton family hotels though. We had a King Suite which was very nice. Everything was clean and hotel staff were friendly, professional and very helpful. We had to change rooms because the door to the bathroom wouldnâ€™t close and wasn't right on its hinges. Front desk staff moved us instantly and took care of the problem. A couple of days later in the next room, we found the hot plates in the kitchen area didnâ€™t work properly. It was about 8 pm. We were working and trying to heat pasta for dinner. Again the front desk staff were great â€“ they sent a maintenance person who fixed the problem very fast. The hotel was fully booked and very busy while we were there, and the staff did everything they could to help guests.This hotel is in a good location for the Elliott Avenue area, waterfront/Alaskan Way and Seattle Center attractions. The bus stop across the road from the hotel takes you to downtown Seattle and we took another bus from there to the Burke Museum of Natural History and Culture. The bus system was easy to use and cheap. We also took the monorail from Seattle Center into the shopping area. We stayed 6 nights here from 18th to 24th August 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: Alex_fll
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a "luxury" room and bathroom without the other luxuries of a 5-star hotel, you'll like this hotel. Our rooms were very comfortable, clean, and well-appointed -- if a little dark. We were sightseeing, so the location was a bit out of the way for all the but the Seattle Center attractions. Hotel is in a nice neighborhood and has many good restaurants within walking distance. We had problems checking in on time at 3pm-- but hotel made up for it on back end by allowing us late check out and holding our luggage until evening. Front desk staff was very helpful with car service arrangements and restaurant recommendations. Also enjoyed the workout room and appreciated the business center. We stayed on a weekend and guests were primarily tourists -- many either leaving for, or returning from, a cruise. Lobby was always super crowded which made it difficult to get through to the elevator -- some better crowd control measures needed here. Also, the hotel's front entrance needs better signage (hard to find!) and a better front door -- it's hard to get through regular size push/pull doors with your hands full of luggage! A revolving door would make things much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: FlynnsterSanJose
Reviews.Content: I have never written a negative review before, but the treatment we got here was way over the top! We arrived early and were told that our room wasnâ€™t ready, ok, it happens. 3 hours later, we had sat and watched guest after guest come into the lobby, be given keys, and sent up top their room. We did not reserve anything special, just a bay side view. We still didnâ€™t have the room at 3:00 which is what the clerk said would be the outer most time. The assistant manager was walking around the whole time we sat there and NEVER asked if she could help, offered us a coffee or anything. We were completely ignored for more than 2 hours while all other guests checked in. Finally we got our room and I contacted Hilton as I was so angry. We wound up on the second floor and their idea of a bay view is a water peep between trees, across two parking lots, 8 lanes of traffic, a railroad and a city park! The manager called and apologized though he could not tell me why we were treated so badly. He promised to send one nightâ€™s stay as a refund when we got home. Guess what??? No refund and the manager refuses to communicate about the incident. The Hilton rep I dealt with canâ€™t get any response. Lousy customer service from start to finish. We will NEVER go anywhere near this place again. Homewood Suites Pike Street is much more central and the service is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DaitheFlu
Reviews.Content: Everytime I'm in Seattle for business I stay at the Homewood. Big rooms, comfortable beds and quiet. Can't bet the huge free breakfast in the morning and free beer and wine at night. The staff (especially Ed) is great. Good bar, Buckley's, just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid paying extra for the 'Bay View'”
Reviews.Author: MaiseyDaisey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly with the Hilton site and with the Advanced Purchase option got a Â£130 a night rate. We were swayed to pay slightly more with the 'carrot' of a Bay View room. When we checked in we were allocated a 2nd floor room with a tiny glimpse of the water between two buildings. The suite was quite large - a room containing a sofa, chair and small dining table with 2 chairs plus a TV, seperated from a King sized bedroom by the kitchenette and bathroom. The sofa converted into a reasonably comfortable bed for a 17 year old boy (or maybe two smaller children) but I don't think 2 adults would have been comfortable on it. This 'inner' room was quite dark and with greeny/brown furnishings needed constant electric light. The bathroom was roomy; the kitchenette was just about functional - hob, 'fridge, sink, microwave with a couple of saucepans and some basic kiitchen tools - okay for a few snacks but not really upto a proper meal. The bedroom was brighter and the bed very comfortable. There was free Wireless Internet inthe rooms too. The breakfast (included in the rate) was excellent for a hotel buffet spread - cereals, toast, baked goods, jams, yogurts, and 2 or 3 different hot items each day (eggs, ham, hash browns etc). Not unsurprisingly it was very popular and if you weren't there at a reasonably early time there was a queue - but that's your choice a few extra minutes in bed or a hassle free breakfast? This definately made the room rate more acceptable. Parking in the hotel secure car park is $15 a night - the street directly outside the front door is free unlimited parking if you can get it. To the side of the hotel it is 2 hour max. free parking and in the other side streets 2 hour max. paid parking. There is a small deli type store a very short distance away and for a slightly longer walk - 3 blocks ish - there is a full Safeway store (if you're a English visitor like us and staying for a time get a Safeway card and reap the savings!) Parking in central Seattle can be very expensive, so if you can park for free and the walk to the Space Needle and catch the monorail in ($2 a person one way) then that can be more economical. A good base - slightly over priced in my opinion because of the 'Bay View' - but clean, with cheery service and even better if you get the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Needs better Beds & Cleaning Service”
Reviews.Author: Ruby176
Reviews.Content: It's an ok hotel for a family since it has more room and kitchen facility. I travelled with 3 children so we booked for two rooms. Since they gave one King bed suites, I requested for a rollaway. Anyone would agree that it was a terrible quality bed. The mattress was so thin and bad quality that you can feel the springs on them. I returned it and just used the sofa bed and that also was a poor quality. The mattress sank in and my son could not rest well. The cleaning service was not satisfactory either. When I came back at the end of the day, I found the room organized but the bathroom floor wasn't properly cleaned. My husband wasn't happy with the situation and he particularly didn't like the breakfast buffet where there were too many people and not enough food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lcnyc123
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Stayed here post an-Alaskan cruise. Located very close to Pier 66 (Norwegian's pier). Hotel room was good sized. Loved the suite format. Room was clean and comfortable. Excellent hot breakfast - had eggs, sausage, tater tots, tortillas, yogurt, fruit, cereal, juice, muffins, toast, etc. Great service. I needed to get change (changed $20 into all $1 bills) to take the seattle bus to see some sights with the family - front desk was very accomodating in giving me change. Super helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel prior to embarking on Alaskan Cruise”
Reviews.Author: hellokittyluver
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Homewood Suites on Western Ave. Once again it was a very consistent stay. We arrived at Seatac airport on Alaska Airlines. Took the light rail to the Westlake Center Station and then took the monorail to the Seattle Center. From there we walked 4 blocks downhill to arrive at Homewood Suites. (All with a rolling suitcase a piece!) Check-in was smooth and friendly. We arrived in time for the nightly reception and light dinner. (Beef teriyaki, salad, and a glass of wine!) The room was nicely appointed and very clean. Walked to the wharf that evening. The next morning ate the complimentary breakfast. We took the shuttle to pier 91 for $5 a person. I will definitely stay at Homewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedReviewer
Reviews.Content: I've used Hilton Honors points for each stay so I can't comment about the price. The front desk staff are so helpful w/ restaurant recommendations, tour info, etc. The rooms are great & I've never slept on a more comfortable bed. You have to walk a little to get to Pike's Place, Space Needle, waterfront, and the other Seattle attractions but you're in a much quieter neighborhood. I love coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Aussie4701
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night en route from Vancouver. Very impressed with the friendly attention from all employees at this hotel from the room attendants to the Manager on duty. Very good value for money as full buffet breakfast is included in the tariff as well as beer/wine and small evening meal. The room we were given was clean, large, very well appointed, and extremely comfortable. Earlier in the month stayed for five nights at the Homewood Suites in Pike Street but would recommend the Downtown suites first if friendliness and attention is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but needs many more NO-SMOKING rooms”
Reviews.Author: displayed
Reviews.Content: Hello, Even though I had a reservation for a non-smoking unit and although I was only able to check-in at 11pm there should have been a designated no-smoking unit available. ALAS, there was none, and I had to spend the first night of my three-night stay, in a smoke-smelling, headache- and cough- producing unit, which was most unsatisfactory. The unit itself was spacious and clean, but the air conditioning outlet was unbelievably directly in the ceiling over my bed !!, causing an annoying draft all night long. Apart from the above, everything else was fine. John Vanderlee, Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay for business or family”
Reviews.Author: uncgrad98
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for me for both of my trips to Seattle in April. It was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites - although I do travel a lot for business - but, this hotel was great. The room was absolutely great - spacious living area, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff provided exceptional customer service - and even helped me by making copies of a document that I needed at no additional charge. In addition, I had issues with my wireless internet connection, and the staff sent me a bridge connection quickly, so that I was not inconvenienced. The breakfast and manager's reception were pretty decent, and was perfect for if you wanted save up money to have dinner elsewhere at one of the better restaurants. If I had one improvement to make, I think they should get updated tvs. Although I stayed here for business, given the staff's level of service and the location, I would seriously come back and stay here again for a leisure trip with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again if the price was right.”
Reviews.Author: nomvula_za
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel on Priceline. We had a king suite on the top floor with views of the water. Suite was nice although nothing fancy, and ideally suited for longer stays with a fully equipped kitchen. Bed was extremely comfortable! We would have had a great sleep except that we discovered the hotel walls are extremely thin. They charge $15 for parking but we got a free spot on the street right in front of the hotel, and walked everywhere we wanted to go. Location is just slightly out of the downtown core, but within reasonable walking distance. All things considered, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal and customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: JCV1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. First of all you get a super deal in the price for a 2 room suite, brand new, clean, with kitchen. You could sleep 4-5 people easy. Also, free High speed Internet included, free wonderful buffet breakfast, and free buffet dinner with beer/wine. I travel a lot and never been in a hotel offering these services for such price (less than $140 per night). Their service was terrific and the hotel was within walking distance to anything downtown Seattle. I would definitely go back. The only improvement I would recommend is on the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: laut0022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend trip. The room was fantastic - clean, quiet, and comfortable. We loved the location, as it was in walking distance to most everything downtown. There were a lot of good restaurants near the hotel. We also enjoyed the breakfast - good selection. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “My 4yo said 'this feels just like a home!'”
Reviews.Author: Kaneohe-Portland
Reviews.Content: It is a comfortable hotel. The suite I stayed in was spacious, the living area had a full sized couch with a side chair and a small dining table. The t.v. was an old CRT type with perfect reception, including HBO. There was another t.v. in the bedroom that did not get used. The kitchen was complete, cookware, utensils, microwave, coffee maker, stovetop, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. Included was a bag of popcorn, tea and coffee. Everything was cozy and clean. Beds were fine although the linens could be a little better. Parking is in a locked facility so it felt secure. Workout center was really nice all precor equipment. We got enough workout walking to the Seattle Center which is 4 blocks away straight uphill. There are a couple of pretty good restaurants around, although we opted to catch the monorail into downtown for dinner. Suite start breakfast was very well done. Build your own breakfast burritos, sausage, eggs, cream of wheat, fruit, yogurt, bread, muffins, bagels and pastry. Orange juice, apple juice, coffee and tea were also available. This is an excellent value but more so a really nice place to stay. Quick walk up the hill and you're in the middle of Seattle Center, with a $2 monorail ride into the middle of downtown. No worries about parking, traffic or the crazy Seattle drivers. I will definitely stay here again. HHonors Gold Level

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue45
Reviews.Content: While the hotel may be a little out of the way although we had no probs walking to everything even to Pike Place Mkt & we r in our 60's. Room typical Homewood just always love the 2nd TV in the b/r. Complimentary breakfast which was very good plus managers reception Mon-Thur with free beer, wine & soft drinks. A pub 2 blocks away where we had a typical pub fare & a small convenience shop in close proximity. Free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: some_honest_guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on Hilton Hhonors points just to see the sites and were pleased. Front desk was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. Complimentary breakfast was perfectly fine and the bay view room was quite nice. 10 minute walk to the Seattle Center, you may want to cab it to Pike's Place. In a quiet neighborhood a bit away from it all, but that may be what you are looking for. We would stay here again and really don't have anything negative to share.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Love it!”
Reviews.Author: SFBusGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business - it was great. Front Desk was helpful, rooms big, have a kitchen if you want it - or breakfast is served daily, and Manager's Reception in the evening is great, includes complimentary beer and wine!! Front Desk staff was great, gave me lots of places to eat out if I wanted, plus told me about all the "hidden fun spots" in Seattle! Free wifi, view from 6th floor, quiet neighborhood - would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great bed! Nice amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Klc312
Reviews.Content: I liked this property. The place was clean and our room was well equipped. One note, the walls seemed very thin. The only downfall for us was the location. We were very far from "downtown" Seattle and were relient on taxis to get back to the great food and nightlife we were looking for. The beds were very comfy though and there was a great mini kitchen. All in all, the property was fine. Parking cost us $15, but I felt good about the garage. We were only 3 blocks from the Key Arena and the space needle, which if that is what you want to go to Seattle for, the its perfect. We were more interested in spending time in downtown, but other than that, its a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: travelagentnancy
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the front desk staff at the Homewood suites on Western Avenue were helpful. That said, from the outside your are expecting a very up to date property and having used Homewood Suites in other cities I was looking forward to a nice stay in a good location. From the moment I arrived and drove around the hotel 3 times to find the check in, to the dangerous underground parking entrance and then the 'aged' room facilities, I could not believe this was the same hotel I checked out on the web. The couch was so uncomfortable that my back was in pain after only a minute. The TV was older than my mothers ancient set and they only had a handful of stations. While I appreciated the underground parking, the entrance was poorly thought out, you had to get out of your car to slip in the card key, unless you have 4 foot long arms.
