After one night I approached the front desk, they asked if I wanted them to contact the other H.S. near the convention center to see if they had space. I moved and even though the rate was $50 a night higher it was worth it. I did noticed a pre-cruise park and stay that was a good price. The location is good, there are several bus routes that you can pick up right out side the hotel. In all, for a newer hotel it was a big disappointment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: One of my best customer service experiences ever. From my first call to the property to check out I was treated great. My two small children and I booked on Priceline and got this hotel. We called the morning of arrival and requested early check in. Unlike most hotels who will "request" early check in this hotel confirmed it on the phone. Nice touch. Check in was smooth and easy. The room was very nice. All of the staff were great. Free internet, great complimentary breakfast, managers reception was awesome and you know what. Free washers and dryers for guest use. A great workout room. Great staff working in a great hotel. This will be my hotel of choice when in Seattle. It should be yours as well.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent property in every way”
Reviews.Author: CGLTD
Reviews.Content: Property is beautifully designed and furnished. Spacious room, friendly and helpful front desk staff. Wonderful customer service. Shuttle service, particularly the driver, was very helpful in getting to and from the tourist attractions. Very good food at the light evening dinner and breakfast buffet. Would highly this property to all travelers to the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “attractive, comfortable, spacious”
Reviews.Author: vmom7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out stay here. Very spacious and comfortable. The staff were great. It was an easy walk to several places to eat, and just a slight bit further for more. It seems to cater more business clients during the week and a variety of travelers during the weekend. We were on the way to pick up our cruise ship the next day. It was about a 5-10 minute taxi drive to Pier 91 and the taxi fare was about $12.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and View”
Reviews.Author: travel1411
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews. Greatest strength is the location to the space needle area - with walking area. Cab Ride is $7.00 to Pike Market area or parking down in the area - runs $10-12 so the cab is cheaper and you can walk back to the hotel in daylight. Try the Crab Pot - great seafood feast dining - 3 persons - around $70.00 - lots of food - you will not be disappointed. No free shuttle to airport. Underground parking good even if your car is just for the ride back to the airport. Fresh coffee all thru the day. Average breakfast- hot muffins and from scratch oatmeal-great. However even though this was a leisure trip sometimes business center is needed. This is an area where improvement is required. No scanner available just fax capabilities. 1 computer- 1 Printer- Slow connections. Wi Fi in the room was very good strong signal.

Reviews.Title: “I found a new favorite hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Surgicare11
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had stayed at a Homewood Suites - it will not be the last. Every staff person that we came in contact iwth was very friendly and very helpful. The room was large and very clean. My husband and I were there with our 3 year old and my mother. We had a King Suite with a pull out sofa - this offered us plenty of privacy for everyone. There was a free meal that night ( The food was not spectacular, but good (and Free) and the next morning breakfast was also provided - very good. We arrived late to the hotel and had to leave early, so I think it was a good location, but didn't get to use it like we had planned. Best hotel stay in a long time (especially for the money). I used my "entertainment rate" and it knocked the price down by about $16.00. The "Entertainment Book" if you are not familiar with it is a coupon book specific to your city (restaurant, movie theaters, etc.)(But also includes nationwide car rental and hotel discounts). I always purchase this book from a school child as a fundraiser for school, but they can be purchased on line - they are well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: kcb1616
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with two small children and had a great time. First night we got there just after the nightly managers reception after arriving into town but they let us sneak into the kitchen to grab some of the left overs...nice little snack before bed. Excellent service overall. Rooms were clean and big and seemed recently updated. Internet connection was just fine. Location is a little out of the way but the bus is not too far away. Decent Thai restaurant (RicenSpice) a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: chocolate1572
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at a Homewood Suites and didn't know what to expect. It was wonderful. The room was very spacious and Jennifer and the rest of the staff could not have been more accommodating. The complimentary dinner and breakfast was just perfect. I really can not say one negative thing about our stay and we will definitely look for a Homewood Suites whenever we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with good amentities, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JenRen
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here. For $119 per night we had a cozy suite with a small living room, kitchenette, decent sized kitchen, and small bedroom with queen sized bed. The room was quiet and had a nice view of Puget Sound. The room was very clean with modern decorations and looked like it had been recently updated and remodeled. The commons areas were all nice and clean and well maintained. They served a nice continental breakfast in the morning with some hot items (oatmeal, biscuits and gravy, eggs, sausage) and cold items (muffins, Nutrigrain bars, toast, etc.). The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pookie136
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great! The suite was a front living room/kitchen, then the bathroom (spacious) and then the bedroom in the back. We had a "bay" view which was funny because you had to look past a parking lot, busy street and some buildings and train tracks to see it but it was there. Bed was comfy although I hate down pillows. There were 2 TV's and nice finishes throughout. The staff was curteous and available. My husband stayed there during the week on business and they had free breakfast and dinner...which for free food he said was pretty good. We would stay there again. It was a bit noisy due to them doing some construction in the hotel but obviously things like this have to be done and they were respectful about times that they did it.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers Seattle”
Reviews.Author: naaman60
Reviews.Content: Look, you really could do better than this hotel. After the fire alarms (one at 07:30 on Christmas day), the hot water failure (almost all day), the internet failure (again, most of the day), the broken clothes driers, the kitchen that fell apart when we touched it, the front desk saying "yes" but meaning "no" we gave up and moved to another hotel. And saved $30/night for a bigger better room! In a better part of town! Long story short, they're undergoing a renovation that is being done poorly (we stayed in a renovated room). The design of the hotel is poor: windows that can't open and windowless, dark "living" rooms for the one bedroom suites. Our kitchen was never "equipped" with pots and pans although we made repeated requests. Our hide a bed comforter never came although we asked for one several times. Unless you have a lot of time to deal with an endless list of challenges and you don't mind paying absolute top dollar for this kind of hotel, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. On the plus side, the breakfast could not have been nicer and the evening reception (with meals, basically) looked nice as well. The front desk did their best to help us most of the time and they did take money off of our bill when we asked them to do so after all of the equipment failures, etc. It's not as if the staff aren't trying, it's just too little too late.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGTraveller
Reviews.Content: We, a party of 3, had an emicable stay. The hotel is well situated and indeed within walking distance (about 10 short blocks) to Pike's Place. The one-bedroom suites are relatively roomy. I can attest to the comfortability of the sofa sleeper. If your party includes more than a couple (that take up the one bedroom), I recommend that you ask for a suite with a bathroom whose door opens to the living area. Unfortunately, the staff apparently is not provided with a floor plan (how hard is it for the proprietor to do so, really?) and it is up to you to make sure that your room is laid out thus - try room *08. Unfortunately, these rooms face the freeway and you will hear traffic noise from the I5 nearby, although to us the noise was not excessive. Some cons: The Internet connection was flaky on the last day of our stay; the parking structure is not for the faint-hearted, requiring precise navigation of your vehicle and expensive ($25 daily) to boot; the taxes add another $25 to your quoted price; the water for shower is not hot enough after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RunnerTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a sisters weekend getaway. The location worked out well...1 was a runner and it was close to running trails, 1 used the gym and thought it was good for a hotel gym. It was about a mile walk to downtown (Pike Place Market) and there was a city bus stop right across the street that went downtown. The free breakfast had a lot to offer...cold & hot cereals, muffins, fruit, yogurt and eggs, french toast, juices, etc. The dining area was spacious and looked out over Elliott Bay (view obstructed some by buildings). The hotel staff was very helpful and nice...no complaints. The only negative thing was our room was across from the elevator and there was quite a bit of noise from that...the walls seemed thin for this caliber hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: heckonwheels
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at this hotel and loved every minute of it. The staff is excellent and very helpful. The room was large and comfy, hot breakfast was very good and the dining area large with a big window for views outside. The evening reception (mid week only) was good with nice wines and a local microbrew on tap. An ok entre was also served each night so if you wanted to save on dinner, that was also an option. It's a short walk...but mainly uphill...to the Space Needle. A long walk to the heart of downtown but buses stop right across the street that will take you there easily. If you add the bus stop around the corner, at least four lines travel by the hotel - it's very easy to do without a car (we also use a wheelchair so that's saying something right there). We also noticed that the Seattle bus drivers are among the most friendly we've come across. Buckley's pub is just around the corner with an excellent happy hour and the best onion rings around. For a good, reasonably priced dinner try their bacon mac 'n cheese. A small mini-mart with a surly counter person is across the street. The hotel is right on the southwestern edge of the Queen Anne neighborhood so it's also in a good area. While all of Seattle is expensive, and this place is no exception, we were able to get a nice suite with a meal (sometimes two) and drinks included for about $40 -50 less than other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: coldmachineUK
Reviews.Content: Most of the downtown hotels in this city are extortionate and rate quite poorly, so we opted for the Homewood Suites further afield. In fact, it's about 10 minutes walk from the Space Needle and the monorail which will actually take you to downtown for only $2 (single). So, distance is negated right off. On top of that the hotel offers a 'home away from home' with a three room suite (kitchen/lounge, bedroom, and bathroom) which is so spacious and comfortable I was taken aback. Dishwasher, microwave, and coffee facilities, complete with set of plates, pans and cutlery, made this extremely appealing for the busy traveller. Free WiFi on request as well, which was fantastic. The suite was not only spacious but also VERY clean. Desk staff and maids were friendly and approachable, and accommodating of our late check-in. Free breakfast in the morning was a treat: plenty of choice from hot food to cereals and fruit. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel if you are visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: jerseyflygirl
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable 7 day stay here. The meals are a real plus... (we really enjoyed the breakfast selection and clean, classy setting). This hotel is a nice location from downtown and the Seattle Waterfront. Just remember that Seattle has some pretty steep hills if you're on foot. The front desk was very helpful with details, although we were disappointed that the 2 cribs that we needed were nowhere to be found upon arrival. My Son-In-Law even called the day before to confirm that they had been ordered. We traveled from the east coast with 3 little ones who were OH SO TIRED when we arrived. BUT a very special thank you to Angel who tracked down a crib and play pen for us when noone else seemed to be able to. Other than that? A really nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Homey Accomodation"”
Reviews.Author: servok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. The desk staff were efficient and personable. They helped us with all of our requests regarding taxi service, nearby restaurants, and hours of certain attractions. There is a business office with computer and printer. The maid service was excellent. The morning breakfast choices were excellent. The rooms are spacious although not luxurious. The gym is minimally equipped ( weights, stationary bike and a treadmill) but you can access an adjacent gym which is excellent. If you choose to walk to the Seatle Space Needle you are less than 10 minutes away. Fun Buckley's pub and an Italian restaurant are less than 3 minutes away. A Catholic Church is less than 5 minutes away. If you choose to walk to the Pike Market, have your best walking shoes because it is 20-30 minutes away. Take a taxi and it is $10.

Reviews.Title: “Good business stay”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: With the exception of a few mis-steps by the staff, this is a great place to stay with very reasonable rates for its location. My room was (as requested) facing the bay. However, being on the second floor somewhat limited my view, but technically I could see the bay. A couple members of the staff were rather curt in their responses when asked for help. However, the younger man at the desk on Saturday night was very helpful when I thought my hair dryer was broken and promptly sent a housekeeper to fix the problem. My room was spacious and clean. I didn't like that the only place to see the television was from the bed - it didn't pull out or swivel at all. The kitchenette was great. This hotel is within walking distance to the Space Needle. A good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: adavidson2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good value for money. The view however is not great even if you get a "waterfront view". The buffet-style breakfasts are ok if you get down before the cattle call. The staff were good, Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ingleberg
Reviews.Content: A recent reviewer complained about this hotel, and I don't agree with any of their gripes. My family had 3 rooms here the night before our Alaskan cruise, and found it to be an excellent choice. The hotel is only 1 mile from the pier, and a short walk from the Space Needle. The shuttle to the pier was already booked into the afternoon on our departure day, so we took taxis. Our rooms were all clean, spacious and comfortable. The beds, air conditioning and showers were great. The free breakfast was definitely a step up from the average mid-priced hotel. We dealt with the front desk staff several times, and always found them to be courteous and professional. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your points or money here!”
Reviews.Author: PatriotsFaninCT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at the Homewood Suites before leaving for an Alaskan cruise. We had used Hilton HHonors points to book our stay. I had selected this hotel from the Hilton site because some of the other Hiltons were already booked and this was the closest one to the piers with available rooms. I was really disappointed in two specific aspects of this hotel: service and cleanliness. On the service front, the front desk manager was just a jerk and any other staff with whom we interacted were unfriendly and unhelpful. When we approached the desk to check in, the first thing out of the manager's mouth was, "boy, you have a lot of luggage", said in a very derogatory way. The whole check-in experience was unpleasant, and when I noticed a sign on the desk about a shuttle to the cruise ship pier and expressed my interest in that, he just nodded that it was available and volunteered no further information. A note about what we learned about the shuttle, since you'll have to do surgery to extract the information from the desk staff: it's $5/pp and although they ask you to sign up for a time on a clipboard kept by the front desk, get there early. Our driver was waiting for us a half hour before our scheduled departure time, and although he had originally told me he wasn't waiting for a party by our name when I asked him, about fifteen minutes later he loaded in another family and then called for us. I hate to imagine what we would have felt like if we had gone downstairs at the arranged time only to discover that the shuttle had already left. And yes, using a shuttle or taxi is a good idea - the distance to the pier is just far and not linear enough that trying to walk it with a lot of luggage (and don't forget it rains a lot in Seattle) could get very uncomfortable. Back to the hotel. Both the public spaces and the rooms were not up to the usual Hilton standard of cleanliness. There is quite an extensive spread for breakfast (it was nice to see a hotel include a free breakfast with some substance since most don't anymore) but seeing the number of flies buzzing around the dining area after the meal was over was just gross. When we got back to our room at 5:00 in the afternoon and found that it hadn't yet been changed, my husband got an earful of nastiness when he flagged down a cleaning person and asked him when he was going to get to our room. It turns out that we didn't gain much by asking him to come in: he didn't even fully make the bed (he just straightened the sheets a little) and he didn't replace any of the items (coffee, soap, etc.) that we had used. On top of that, in a city that is probably more environmentally responsible than most in our country, I was shocked that he put a grand total of four glasses in the dishwasher and ran it on a full cycle. If you're looking to travel to Seattle on your HHonors points and this is the only hotel available with them, my advice is to hang onto your points for another trip and just stay at one of the many wonderful boutique hotels and inns that Seattle offers instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at this Property”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all let me clarify there isn't jackhammering going on at this hotel now, we stayed here in mid-June 2008 and had a great stay. The rooms are nice, if you have a Bay-View ensure you have a room above floor 3 or you want have a Bay-View because of the buildings in front of the hotel. The hotel is a 30-35 minute walk to Pike Place Market & 10-15 to the Waterfront. The breakfast area was more like a college eating session than anything. Very busy and crowded and if you don't get there in time might not get everything that was available when breakfast started. The Managers Receptions were nice and complementary wine & beer was available. The hotel has no pool for those who like to swim during their stay but does have a 24 hour fitness center and there are plenty of hills around the hotel to walk and jog as well. Some comments: Front Desk staff were very friendly & helpful The hotel is the closest of all the Hilton Properties to the waterfront The rooms are in good shape, but the bathrooms are small in comparsion to other Hilton Hotels & the sort that i've stayed at. The internet service stinks in the room even though they tought to have this service that is 50 times faster than usual service. It is more like 50 times slower, 5 mins just to get loaded onto AOL fro m the room, but from the 24 hour business center it took about 10 seconds. A good hotel & I would stay here again. We were in Room 504 and had a nice view of the Bay each day & night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the construction noise on the nearby streets”
Reviews.Author: anchorage1977
Reviews.Content: Just a quick warning: there is about a month's worth of construction goin on outside this hotel on Western Ave and Elliott Ave. If you stay here, request a non-view room (or a city view room) to avoid the jack hammer noise at night. So far the construction is limited to the evenings and night. It seems they are trying to avoid major traffic hang ups. Unfortunately, this does affect ones ability to sleep here. Otherwise a good hotel. The rooms are comfortable, the staff friendly, the walls thin, the weekends filled with kids. It's all been said in other posts and both the positive and negative reviews seem true by my view.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 100tamember100
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites. The outside looked very nice, however, the furnishings in the room looked a little tired and worn. I had requested and received a bay view room. The bay view was partially obstructed by the building across the street. The hotel staff were very pleasant and overall the property was in good condition. Not new, but not too terribly worn out. In general, a good room for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: ghillier
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Homewood Suites and it was better than expected. The best part was the courteous Front Desk personnel that assisted me when my wallet was stolen and I had to pay cash to check in - and they were happy to accomodate me. The room was large and comfy and very clean. A little off the beaten path but still convenient. $15 a day for parking is pricey but that is Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Plagued with noisy children, rooms with paper-thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: kbp619
Reviews.Content: It shouldn't be any surprise a "suites" type hotel will attract families. That said, it doesn't give them the right to let their bratty kids spin out of control as if they've gone through a case of Red Bull to the point of bouncing off the walls (which happen to be next to my room). If I wanted to hear all this banging and screaming, I'd fly out east to visit my nephews, not shell out $200+ a night while on "vacation". Contacting the front desk didn't help much either. They said they'd send someone up (which they did) and it got quiet, until that person left, and then the noise started up again. The hotel manager did, however, offer to move us to a different room, but not until the next day, since it was Saturday and they were sold out. The hotel offers free breakfast and a Mon-Thurs "happy hour", neither of which were all too appealing (free is free). There were, thankfully, many other choices within walking distances. On that note, we were also thankful for Mediterranean Inn being 3 blocks away. No screaming kids, better location and security. Sure, the rooms were smaller (same features for the most part), but who really) spends all their time in the room anyway? And for all you parents out there, please show some respect to others and control your children (not only in hotels, but on airplanes as well).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Agforguy
Reviews.Content: Had to get away from the cold and snow, so we went to Seattle. This hotel has a decent location to the downtown core without the extremely high parking rates one finds in Seattle. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Minor disappointment but still OK”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights in Octoberâ€™07. I was expecting something a little bit more â€œfancyâ€� based on the webpage, so perhaps four stars instead of three stars actually received. Certainly didnâ€™t except full luxury hotel, but still something slightly more. Maybe this just is the normal level of Homewood Suites chain that I simply wasnâ€™t aware of since it was my first stay in any Homewood hotel. Breakfast was not something to write home about, in fact it was pretty poor. Just a small hot section, one sort of bagel, one sort of muffin etc. Vegetable/fruit selection extremely limited. There was free food (such as spaghetti) in the evening which was OK, including African Amber in the tap which was a nice surprise. Huge two room suite, probably ~70 square meters with e.g. small kitchen and large flatscreen TV. Windows facing Puget Sound and Space Needle on the other side (top of Needle visible behind houses). Location is OK, though not certainly in the downtown. ~5min walk to Space Needle area (museums, restaurants, amusement park etc) and monorail service to city centre. Nearest convenience store right next door, a nice sports bar a block away. So maybe a minor disappointment, but still pretty OK. No major complaints as such. Would I return there? Hmmm, perhaps, but would check also for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: agentchris
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Homewood Suites in Seattle, both prior to a cruise. As a Diamond HH member, I stay in Homewoods quite a bit and this one is the best I have ever stayed in. The rooms are nice (if you can grab one at the end of the hall they have a half circle design in the front with plenty of windows and potential bay views out the front and Space Needle views out the bedroom) and this place has the best morning breakfast and evening meal of any Homewood I have stayed at. The offer parking (never charged myself for parking on 2 stays) and it is a very easy walk to the Space Needle complex and to the waterfront. They were also offering a shuttle to both cruise ship piers. Great place, looking forward to my next stay there. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Great value, one of teh best vales near downtwon”
Reviews.Author: ewjnews
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the Downtown hotels in Seattle and with the exception of the Hyatt, Mayflower, and Westin all the hotels are overpriced and lack decent customer service. For a city of its size and stature, it should have better hotels. I have stayed at the Homewood, just outside of downtown a couple of times. While the place it nothing great, because of its location, free internet, a decent breakfast and evening snacks the hotel is a great value. No it is not in downtown but you could taxi to downtown rather cheaply (I typically take the bus). The rooms are larger than the downtown hotels and while no one will take your bag to your room. The parking prices are reasonable and it is close to the great food and the Seattle Center. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood for two nights prior to a cruise. It's located a little outside the downtown area so cabs are needed to get to most attractions, except for the Space Needle area. We walked from the Public Market one afternoon but it was too far for comfort. The hotel was clean and well maintained but there was a bit of street noise, which was easily eliminated by leaving the AC fan on. Breakfast was OK...typical for this class of hotel. With all of the great food we found in Seattle, breakfast was not a big concern for us. The hotel offers transportation to the cruise piers for an extra charge. We reserved a private car but it did not show so the desk called us a cab. This was probably cheaper method.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: irishrover
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel. On arrival the staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. We could not fault the room which was large, clean, and very well equipped with just about everything you could need. The room and hotel were also very quiet at night. I don't know whether this was unusual, but we were amazed at breakfast the next morning to see how busy the hotel actualy was because it seemed so quiet the night before. Judging from the guests at breakfast it is a very popular hotel with families. The hotel is within walking distance of Pike place market (if you like a nice walk) and the walk there also brings you past the Sculpture Park. However, when we returned at night after being at a concert at the Seattle Symphony, we did not think it was wise to walk back and took a taxi which cost 10 dollars. There is free internet available, which was helpful and a very comfortable lounge area. The free breakfast the next morning was OK and there was plenty of choice, including lots of fresh fruit. I really have no complaints about the hotel at all and would not hestitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rileydog45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood for 5 nights. We had booked, and were charged for, a bay view room. Our room on the second floor did not have a bay view, unless you count a small slot between two buildings dow the street. We were paying for 3 adults but had to call twice for bedding for the hide a bed. There were never enough towls, wash clouths, etc. for 3 people. Breakfast items were plentiful but items that should have been served hot were luke warm at best.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seattle for one night here and the hotel itself was pretty nice. Check in was easy and we got to request a room on the top floor with a bay view earlier then the check-in time since we got there about 2 hours early. Check-in is at 3pm. We got a good rate on a King Bay view room with a kitchenette. The room was nice and big. There was a sitting room with tv. then the kitchen and bathroom. And, then you walked into the King room with a big window. The bed was super comfy! At first, we didn't think the neighborhood was very nice. It seemed a little ghetto as we drove down Western Avenue. But, we never walked down that way, we always walked up towards the Space Needle that was a short walk away. It was a nice walk too. The Queen Anne neighborhood just 2 blocks away was cute. There is a nice bar called Buckley's that we went to twice and it was enjoyable. It was very low key. We didn't walk to the market since it was a little too far to walk. It was only a mile or so but with some small hills on the way it wasn't our cup of tea. Instead we went to the Space Needle area and took the Monorail down to the Mall on 5th and walked 4 blocks to the market. It cost $4 round trip or $2 one-way. The free breakfast was great the next morning. They had a big buffet area and big seating room with dining tables. What was also nice was that they included free starbucks coffee packets in the rooms, and free popcorn. The only thing that sucked was no windows to open for fresh air and no fan in the bathroom. Kinda weird but I assumed they want to prevent smoking? Well, the toilet was clogged and they didn't have plungers in the bathroom so we had to have someone come up and plunge the toilet and replace the flusher. It wasn't too bad though, they were quick about it. The staff was nice. They had a suite shop in the lobby with snacks and beverages as well as souveniers to buy. I got a picture frame of $9 vs. $15 at a Seattle shop downtown. Go figure! They also provid toothbrushes and toothpaste for free if forgotten, which we did. The only thing I didn't like was that they charge $15 per car to park in their parking garage. I thought this was tacky. There was a parking lot adjacent that cost $5 to park until midnight all day on the weekends. But, we just paid the $15 to move our cars inside at night so they would be safe. Overall the stay was pretty good!

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Seattle-Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 206 Western Avenue West, Seattle, WA 98119
